member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE
member.summary: Specifies different types of gradients that can be used as backgrounds in VSPackages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_FILETAB
member.summary: File Tab. Typically a vertical gradient with a light gray at the top and a medium gray at the bottom. Usually is the active tab on the Solution Explorer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_PANEL_BACKGROUND
member.summary: Panel Background. Typically a horizontal gradient with light gray at the left and a medium gray at the right. Usually is the background of the Visual Basic error list window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_SHELLBACKGROUND
member.summary: Shell background. Typically a horizontal gradient of light gray at the left to a slightly lighter gray at the right. Usually is the background of the tabs on a docked window, the color of a splitter window frame, and the auto-hide space for the Toolbox and Server Explorer panels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_TOOLBOX_HEADING
member.summary: Toolbox Heading. Typically a single medium gray color with no actual gradient. Usually is the background of the Toolbox heading.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_TOOLTAB
member.summary: Tool tab. Typically a vertical gradient with a medium gray at the top and a light gray at the bottom. Usually is the background of any tab that is not selected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_TOOLWIN_ACTIVE_TITLE_BAR
member.summary: Tool window active title bar. Typically a vertical gradient with a light blue at the top and a medium blue at the bottom. Usually is the background of an active tool window title bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_TOOLWIN_INACTIVE_TITLE_BAR
member.summary: Tool window inactive title bar. Typically a solid medium gray with no gradient. Typically seen as the background of a tool window when it is docked and does not currently have focus (undocked tool windows use standard Windows title bar colors).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__GRADIENTTYPE.VSGRADIENT_TOOLWIN_BACKGROUND
member.summary: Tool window default background. Typically a horizontal gradient with a light gray at the left and a medium gray at the right. Usually is the background of the Toolbox.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE
member.summary: Flags for HandsOn/Off functions of the interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE.HANDSOFFMODE_ReadAccess
member.summary: Caller must have read-only access (shared read locks are OK to keep open).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE.HANDSOFFMODE_WriteAccess
member.summary: Caller must have write-only access (shared write locks are OK to keep open).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE.HANDSOFFMODE_DeleteAccess
member.summary: Caller must have access to delete or rename.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE.HANDSOFFMODE_AsyncOperation
member.summary: Caller must have access to the file for an extended period of time. Caller guarantees to call to tell parties when they can access the file. Incompatible do not nest. HandsOffFiles returns E_ACCESSDENIED if there is a pending incompatible . There can be multiple nested Async operations but and operations cannot be nested.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE.HANDSOFFMODE_FullAccess
member.summary: Caller must have power to rename or delete the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__HANDSOFFMODE.HANDSOFFMODE_ReadWriteAccess
member.summary: Caller must have both read and write.

member.summary: BOOL/EMPTY. Tri-state value of dirty star (*) in window caption

member.summary: BOOL. Specifies whether pane is holding OLE doc object

member.summary: HWND parent of OwnerDocked window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSFPROPID2.VSFPROPID_ParentFrame
member.summary: of parent container for OwnerDocked window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSFPROPID2.VSFPROPID_ToolWindowDocCookie
member.summary: VT_INT_PTR value for (RDT) key for document associated with a tool window (eg. Code Definition Window). Setting this property enables both caption dirty indicator (*) management and the firing of RDT events for the tool window. It is assumed that the frame caption is set correctly, without a dirty indicator (*), before this property is set, as setting this property will cause a caption dirty indicator (*) to be added, if the document is dirty. Also, when this property is set, the RDT event is immediately fired to indicate that a new document has been show.

member.summary: BOOLEAN: true if the solution node is hidden in the integrated development environment (IDE).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_DeferredSaveSolution
member.summary: BOOLEAN: is the Solution "zero-impact" (permanent save is performed explicitly through File.SaveAll).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_SimplifiedConfigurations
member.summary: BOOLEAN: true if the solution is in simplified configuration mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_IsSolutionClosing
member.summary: BOOLEAN: true if a solution file being closed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_IsAProjectClosing
member.summary: IUnknown interface for of project being closed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_IsSolutionOpeningDocs
member.summary: BOOLEAN: true if the solution re-opening the documents that were open when the solution was last closed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_IsOpenNotificationPending
member.summary: BOOLEAN: true if the notification is pending. This occurs when a new project is being created by using a new solution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_ProjectLoadSecurityDialogState
member.summary: I4: State of the project load security dialog kept between different language packages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_SolutionUserFileCreatedOnThisComputer
member.summary: BOOLEAN: true if the .suo file that accompanies the solution file was originally created on the same computer it is being opened on. See . Read only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_NewProjectDlgPreferredLanguage
member.summary: BSTR: Preferred language for the New Project dialog; if there is no preferred language an empty length string is returned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPROPID2.VSPROPID_FIRST2
member.summary: Indicates the first VSPROPID_.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPUBLISHOPTS
member.summary: Specifies options for calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSPUBLISHOPTS.PUBOPT_PUBLISHCONTEXT
member.summary: Publish context

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSQueryEditFlags2
member.summary: This enumeration is an extension of , and specifies additional flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSQueryEditFlags2.QEF_AllowUnopenedProjects
member.summary: Allows calls to the method for files of projects that are not loaded or that haven't finished loading.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSQueryEditFlags2.QEF_CheckoutLocalVersion
member.summary: Attempts to check out local version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSQueryEditFlags2.QEF_CheckoutLatestVersion
member.summary: Attempts to check out latest version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSQueryEditFlags2.QEF_DetectAnyChangedFile
member.summary: Enables the detection of content changes for files that are not currently open in the IDE (editor buffer or project/solution file). If such changes occur, QER_Changed will be returned in .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSRDTSAVEOPTIONS2
member.summary: Specifies additional save options for a document in the running document table (RDT).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSRDTSAVEOPTIONS2.RDTSAVEOPT_SkipNewUnsaved
member.summary: Activates the editor window of a document, if a save operation causes an error. Indicates that new unsaved files (created via File.New File) should be skipped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSRDTSAVEOPTIONS2.RDTSAVEOPT_SaveAllButThis
member.summary: The supplied document token indicates the exception and everything but it will be saved normally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSRDTSAVEOPTIONS2.RDTSAVEOPT_FSaveAs
member.summary: Indicates that the save is a result of a document close. Determines if Visual Studio should display a Save As dialog box.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSAVEDEFERREDSAVEFLAGS
member.summary: Used with calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSAVEDEFERREDSAVEFLAGS.VSDSF_HIDEADDTOSOURCECONTROL
member.summary: Hides the Add Solution to Source Control check box in the Save dialog box.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCENLISTMENTFACTORYOPTIONS
member.summary: Options used by the enlistment choice user interface (part of the source control support).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCENLISTMENTFACTORYOPTIONS.VSSCC_EFO_CANBROWSEENLISTMENTPATH
member.summary: The user should be allowed to edit the enlistment path field through the use of a browse dialog box. If this option is not specified, then the user can change the enlistment path only by manually editing the path field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCENLISTMENTFACTORYOPTIONS.VSSCC_EFO_CANEDITENLISTMENTPATH
member.summary: The user should be allowed to edit the enlistment path field manually. If this option is not set, then the field is read-only and can be changed only with a browse dialog box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCENLISTMENTFACTORYOPTIONS.VSSCC_EFO_CANBROWSEDEBUGGINGPATH
member.summary: The project supports an additional debugging path, and the user should be allowed to set the debugging path through a browse dialog box. If this option is not specified, then the user can change the debugging path only by manually editing the path field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCENLISTMENTFACTORYOPTIONS.VSSCC_EFO_CANEDITDEBUGGINGPATH
member.summary: The project supports an additional debugging path, and the user should be allowed to edit the debugging path field manually. If this option is not specified, then the debugging path is read-only and can be changed only with a browse dialog box.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCPROVIDERBINDINGOPTIONS
member.summary: Indicating whether it can deal with browsing for a source control server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCPROVIDERBINDINGOPTIONS.VSSCC_PBO_CANBROWSESERVERPATH
member.summary: The project supports a browse dialog box used to find a source control server. If this is not set, then Visual Studio relies on a default server browse dialog box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCPROVIDERBINDINGOPTIONS.VSSCC_PBO_CANEDITSERVERPATH
member.summary: The project server path can be manually edited by the user and validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSCCPROVIDERBINDINGOPTIONS.VSSCC_PBO_CANDISPLAYSERVERPATH
member.summary: Shows the server path when the user is given a choice of source control servers. If not set, then the user sees only the source control package's name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSHOWCONTEXTMENUOPTS
member.summary: Specifies options for display of context menus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSHOWCONTEXTMENUOPTS.VSCTXMENU_SELECTFIRSTITEM
member.summary: Automatically select the first item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSHOWCONTEXTMENUOPTS.VSCTXMENU_SHOWUNDERLINES
member.summary: Show keyboard mnemonic underlines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSHOWCONTEXTMENUOPTS.VSCTXMENU_SUPPORTSTYPEAHEAD
member.summary: Supports typeahead, and should also be a sorted dynamic item list.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSSLNOPENOPTIONS2.SLNOPENOPT_LoadingAsync

member.summary: Provider is always visible in drop-down list even if it has no tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKPROVIDERFLAGS.TPF_NOAUTOROUTING
member.summary: Does not automatically route this provider's tasks to predefined buckets based on their categories.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS
member.summary: Task Value flags returned by .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_EDITABLE
member.summary: This value can be changed by the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_ENUM
member.summary: The value is not arbitrary, but may only be one of a limited set of strings provided by the task item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_BINARY_STATE
member.summary: An enum with only two possible states. The user can switch the state by a UI action similar to selecting a check box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_HORZ_RIGHT
member.summary: The value is aligned against the right edge of the column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_HORZ_CENTER
member.summary: The value is horizontally centered in the column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_STRIKETHROUGH
member.summary: The value is drawn with a strikethrough font style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKVALUEFLAGS.TVF_FILENAME
member.summary: This textual value will be treated as a file name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS
member.summary: Flags for calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS.VSTAEXF_Default
member.summary: The are pre-pended to currently active key binding scopes then command is fired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS.VSTAEXF_NoFireCommand
member.summary: Do not fire the command through command routing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS.VSTAEXF_IgnoreActiveKBScopes
member.summary: The are used INSTEAD of currently active key binding scopes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS.VSTAEXF_UseTextEditorKBScope
member.summary: Translate keys using TextEditor key bindings. Equivalent to passing CMDUIGUID_TextEditor, CMDSETID_StandardCommandSet97, and guidKeyDupe for scopes and the flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS.VSTAEXF_UseGlobalKBScope
member.summary: Translate keys using Global key bindings. Equivalent to passing CMDSETID_StandardCommandSet97 and guidKeyDupe for scopes and the flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTRANSACCELEXFLAGS.VSTAEXF_AllowModalState
member.summary: By default this function cannot be called when the shell is in a modal state, since command routing is inherently dangerous. However if you must access this in a modal state, specify this flag, but keep in mind that many commands will cause unpredictable behavior if fired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDGETFLAGS.BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPGUID
member.summary: Interpret the parameter of as a component category ID (CATID). When you set this flag, makes first call before it determines which builder to return. Do not set this flag if you are use a builder CLSID.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDGETFLAGS.BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPENABLEPROMPT
member.summary: Used only if you set BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPGUID. Provides a user prompt to select the builder. If this flag is set, then BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPPROMPTALWAYS determines whether or not to prompt the user. Not setting this flag is the same as passing BLDPROMPTOPT_PROMPTNEVER to MapBuilderCATIDToCLSID.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDGETFLAGS.BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPPROMPTALWAYS
member.summary: Used only if you set both BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPGUID and BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPENABLEPROMPT. When you set this flag, it always causes a user prompt to choose the builder. If you don't set this flag, then the user is prompted only if there is more than one registered builder for a category and the category has no default registered builder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDGETFLAGS.BLDGETOPT_FOBJECTBUILDER
member.summary: Requested builder is an Object Builder. An Object Builder is a builder invoked after it inserts a new OLE object or control in a container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDGETFLAGS.BLDGETOPT_FNOINTRINSICS
member.summary: Build without intrinsics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDPROMPTOPT.BLDPROMPTOPT_PROMPTIFMULTIPLE
member.summary: Prompt the user if there is no default and there is more than one registered builder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDPROMPTOPT.BLDPROMPTOPT_PROMPTALWAYS
member.summary: Always prompt the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.BLDPROMPTOPT.BLDPROMPTOPT_PROMPTNEVER
member.summary: Never prompt the user. Use the default builder if there is one. Otherwise, use the first registered builder.

Returns S_OK if a builder exists.
Returns S_FALSE if it does not exist it
member.param: [in] A CLSID or CATID for a builder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IBuilderWizardManager.EnableModeless(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets builder dialogs to modeless or modal.
member.returns: Returns S_OK. This method does not fail.
member.param: [in] true to enable modeless dialogs; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IBuilderWizardManager.GetBuilder(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.Object@,System.IntPtr@,System.Guid@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Requests a builder by CLSID or component category ID (CATID).
member.returns:
S_OK if the builder interface is successfully returned.
S_FALSE if the dialog UI is canceled.
E_NOINTERFACE if the builder is not supported.
An error HRESULT from CoCreatInstance if the builder automation server could not be instantiated.
member.param: [in] The CLSID or CATID of the builder. You can use a CATID only if you specify BLDGETOPT_AUTOMAPGUID as part of .
[in] Options as bit flags. Values are from the enumeration.
[in] Optional owner HWND for all dialogs if the user needs to choose which builder to run. Used only if you specify both BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPGUID and BLDGETOPT_FAUTOMAPENABLEPROMPT as part of .

[out] The IDispatch of the application the caller can pass to the invoke call on the builder. The caller must call release for this interface. You can use NULL if this IBuilderWizardManager does not have an IDispatch or the caller is not interested in getting the application IDispatch.

[out] Calculated HWND the caller should use as the owner HWND for invoking the builder. May be NULL if the caller is not interested in the calculated hwnd. Set to the HWND of the application main frame window if hwndPromptOwner is NULL. then *phwndBuilderOwner will be set to the hwnd of Application main frame window. Set to hwndPromptOwner if hwndPromptOwner is not NULL. This is the case when invoking the builder from within another modal dialog.
[in] Interface the client wants from the builder OLE server. The client needs to know the interface to ask for based on the type of builder wanted.
[out] IUnknown interface pointer of the builder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IBuilderWizardManager.MapBuilderCATIDToCLSID(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Returns the CLSID of a specific builder given a component category ID (CATID).
member.returns:
S_OK if the CATID maps to a builder.
S_FALSE if there is no builder for the CATID.
member.param:
[in] The CATID of a builder.
If the GUID is a CLSID of a specific builder and supports this builder, this method returns S_OK and sets to .
[in] Bit flags controlling whether there is a user prompt to choose the builder. Values are taken from the enumeration.

[in] Owner HWND for all dialogs and windows. May be NULL. If NULL, IBuilderWizardManager uses the HWND for the application frame window. Note: This method may bring up a modal dialog asking the user to choose the builder to use.
[out] The CLSID of a specific builder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IBuilderWizardManager.MapObjectToBuilderCLSID(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Returns the CLSID of a builder for an OLE object given the object's CLSID.
member.returns:
S_OK if the CLSID maps to a builder.
S_FALSE if there is no builder for the CLSID.
member.param: [in] CLSID of the object
[in] Bit flags controlling whether there is a user prompt to choose the builder. Values are taken from the enumeration.

[in] Owner HWND for all dialogs and windows. May be NULL. If NULL, IBuilderWizardManager uses the HWND for the application frame window. Note: This method may bring up a modal dialog asking the user to choose the builder to use.
[out] The CLSID of a specific builder.

member.summary: This method determines if loading is complete for a solution or project being loaded asynchronously.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.param: [in] Physical path to the project to be loaded from source control.

member.summary: This method determines whether a specified project must be loaded asynchronously.

member.param: [in] Physical path to the specified project.
[out] Returns nonzero (true) if the project must be loaded asynchronously. Otherwise, returns zero (false) if the project can be loaded synchronously.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsynchOpenFromSccProjectEvents
member.summary: Provides progress information during asynchronous loading of a project or solution from source control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsynchOpenFromSccProjectEvents.OnFilesDownloaded(System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Called during an asynchronous load to indicate one or more files have been downloaded.
member.returns:
If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
If an error is returned, the source control package may cancel the load process if it so chooses (typically, if this method returns an error, something catastrophic has happened and the load should probably not continue).
member.param: [in] Number of file names that are in the array. This value should always be greater than 0.
[in] Array of physical paths of files that have been successfully loaded so far.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsynchOpenFromSccProjectEvents.OnLoadComplete
member.summary: Called when an asynchronous load is done.
member.returns:
If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
A source control package does not typically expect this method to return an error code, since there is nothing the source control package can do about the error once the load is complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsynchOpenFromSccProjectEvents.OnLoadFailed
member.summary: Called when downloading of project content fails.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.summary: Calls ParseOutputStringForInfo to the launch pad If task item text is returned, the launch pad creates a task list item by using the information it returned. If only filename and line number information is returned, the launch pad adds the line to the output window and uses the filename and line number as the navigation information for the output line.

member.param: [in] One line of output text.
[out] Fully qualified file name for task list item (may be null).
[out] File line number for task list item (may be null).
[out] Priority for task list item (may be null).
[out] Description text for task list item (may be null).
[out] Help keyword for task list item (may be null).

An array of guids that identify the symbol libraries
If is set to , the component set uses the libraries specified in the guid array to browse the components added to the set. The cannot be a null in this case.
If is set to , the component set excludes the libraries specified in the guid array from browsing the components added to the set. If the is null, the set does not exclude any libraries.

An array of VSITEMIDs to be checked out during the add parameter operation, if the IVsRefactorNotify implementer needs to modify additional files as a part of the refactoring operation. member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSQLCLRReferences.InvokeNewReferencesDlg(System.Object,System.Object,System.UInt32,System.String,System.UInt32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsComponentUser)
member.summary: Invokes the SQL CLR Add New Reference dialog.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: [in] Pointer to the interface of the connection object.
[in] Pointer to the interface of the assembly supporting the dialog.
[in] Integer. Flags specifying add options. Values taken from the enumeration.
[in] String containing the path to a file to use for a cache.
[in] Integer containing a value from the __SQL_ASSEMBLY_PERMISSION_SET enumeration. Indicates the permission level on the assembly: SQLAP_SAFE (1), SQLAP_EXTERNAL (2), or SQLAP_UNRESTRICTED (3).
[in] Pointer to the to use for callbacks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSQLCLRReferences.UpdateReferences(System.Object,System.Object,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String[],System.String,System.UInt32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSQLCLRReferencesUpdateCallback)
member.summary: Use to synchronizes the local cache and the server.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: [in] Pointer to the interface of the connection object.
[in] Pointer to the interface of the assembly.
[in] Integer. Flags specifying update options. Taken from the enumeration.
[in] Integer. The number of assembly names in rgszAssemblies.
[in] Array of strings containing the names of the assemblies to update.
[in] String containing the path to a file to use for a cache.
[in] Integer containing a value from the __SQL_ASSEMBLY_PERMISSION_SET enumeration. Indicates the permission level on the assembly: SQLAP_SAFE (1), SQLAP_EXTERNAL (2), or SQLAP_UNRESTRICTED (3).
[in] Pointer to a interface to use for callbacks.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSQLCLRReferencesUpdateCallback
member.summary: Defines the callback function for reporting changes in SQL procedures compiled into assemblies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSQLCLRReferencesUpdateCallback.UpdateResult(System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IErrorInfo,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reports the result of updating an assembly.

member.param: [in] String containing the name of the assembly updated.
[in] Integer containing a value from the __SQL_ASSEMBLY_PERMISSION_SET enumeration. Indicates the permission level on the assembly: SQLAP_SAFE (1), SQLAP_EXTERNAL (2), or SQLAP_UNRESTRICTED (3).

[in] Pointer to an interface reporting any error information.
[in] Integer—the action taken. A value from the enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsTaskProvider3.GetProviderGuid(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Returns a unique Identifier for this provider. This is used to persist & restore per-provider data managed by the task list, such as user customizations of column width & order. If it is not practical to assign a GUID to this provider (e.g. the provider is dynamically created at run-time and the identity cannot be preserved across VS sessions), you may return GUID_NULL. However, you should be aware that certain functionality (such as UI settings persistence and the IVsTaskList2.SetActiveProvider method) will not work in that case.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: [out] A pointer to a Provider Identifier (an object of type GUID).

member.summary: Called when the user begins editing a task in-place. Providers may want to avoid scrolling the tasklist or changing the selection during editing, since these actions can force in-place edit mode to be canceled abruptly.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: [in] A pointer to an object of type IVsTaskItem.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsTaskProvider3.OnEndTaskEdit(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsTaskItem,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called when the user finishes editing a task in-place. fCommitChanges indicates whether the user chose to commit the changes or discard them. This method may set *pfAllowChanges to FALSE to disallow the user from exiting edit mode. If fCommitChanges is TRUE, the changes will have already been persisted down to the task item.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns . If it fails, it returns an error code.
member.param: [in] A pointer to an object of type IVsTaskItem.
[in] A Boolean value set to TRUE if the user chooses to commit the changes.
[out] A Boolean value set to FALSE to disallow the user from exiting edit mode, or to TRUE if the changes were already persisted down to the task item.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.tagVSQueryEditResultFlags2
member.summary: This enumeration specifies bitflags, returned from the method, that tell whether a file was checked out and/or changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.tagVSQueryEditResultFlags2.QER_Reloaded
member.summary: The QueryEditFiles operation caused check out from source control, a new version was retrieved from the source control database, and the file was reloaded in memory (editor buffer or project/solution file). The caller may need to abort the initial operation that caused the edit if it cannot tolerate the newly reloaded content of the file—for example, if calculations made based on the content before the QueryEditFiles call may not apply to the new content).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.tagVSQueryEditResultFlags2.QER_Changed
member.summary: The QueryEditFiles operation caused check out from source control and a new version was retrieved. If the file is opened in the IDE, QER_Reloaded will also be retuned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCENLISTMENTCHOICE
member.summary: These values indicate a project's willingness to work with choosing an enlistment (a local working copy of a project or solution that is under source control). Being able to choose an enlistment allows the user to change the location of a stored project when it is pulled from source control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCENLISTMENTCHOICE.VSSCC_EC_NEVER
member.summary: This project does not support enlistment choice. This is the same as if the project didn't implement the interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCENLISTMENTCHOICE.VSSCC_EC_OPTIONAL
member.summary: This project allows enlistment choice but does not require it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCENLISTMENTCHOICE.VSSCC_EC_COMPULSORY
member.summary: This project requires the user to pick an enlistment.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCPROVIDERBINDING
member.summary: These are the options a project can return indicating its willingness to work with a custom source control package.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCPROVIDERBINDING.VSSCC_PB_STANDARD
member.summary: This project does not have a custom source control package (this value is the same as not implementing the interface at all).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCPROVIDERBINDING.VSSCC_PB_CUSTOM_DISABLED
member.summary: This project cannot be put under source control because the required custom source control package is not installed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCPROVIDERBINDING.VSSCC_PB_CUSTOM
member.summary: This project not only has a custom source control package, it also can be used immediately.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSSCCPROVIDERBINDING.VSSCC_PB_STANDARD_DISABLED
member.summary: This project is offline and therefore cannot be added to source control at this time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.cxMinWidth
member.summary: The minimum column width in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.fAllowHide
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to change the column's visibility.

member.summary: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to sort by clicking on the column's header.

member.summary: Flag indicating the column is sorted in descending order (default is ascending).

member.summary: Column will be automatically resized to fit whenever its content changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.fMoveable

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.fShowSortArrow
member.summary: Flag indicating whether a sort arrow is shown in the header when the list is sorted by this column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.fSizeable
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the column may be resized by the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.fVisibleByDefault
member.summary: Flag indicating whether this column is visible by default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.VSTASKCOLUMN.iDefaultSortPriority
